value.0: Ahh the other clans... which would you care to know about.
These creatures obsess over control but have no sensibility for the finer points of power.

One of the first lessons we learn is that these Old World monsters still want nothing more than to rend our flesh from our bones. If that is the tune they prefer, we shall see how they dance when their rotting mansions and burning down around them.
They are Aesop's grasshopper; we are the ant. They think to justify their immortality with their art and their parties, but the cold times are coming sooner than they think.
They may fancy themselves magicians after a fashion, but give me 10 minutes with one of these charlatans and we shall see whose art has the true power.
Some tasks are too noisesome even for us, and the Nosferatu make appropriate lackeys to those ends.

Their prattle of "insights" unknown to us grows tiresome very quickly. But however poor dinner guests they may be, they are seers of exceptional clarity. There's a trick to such perceptual shortcuts, and we can yet discover it.
For all their pretense of sophistication, their willingness to lie down with the Tzimesce clearly reveals their true savagery.
Those beasts feign loyalty, but are all too willing to hand us over to the Tzimisce if an excuse presents itself. We must be certain always to remain stronger than these hyenas.
Damn them! Always prying their slitted eyes and forked tongues, and always slipping back into the darkest corners, smiling the whole time! What do they know?

Time has been cruel. When first we met, the Brujah were the scholars of our kind. Now they have crumbled to a sorry state, and we have taken up the flame of knowledge in their stead. It is only fitting, bit it somehow seems wasteful. No matter.
What is there to say? but to erase them from the face of the planet as quickly as we can - or convince others to do it for us.

No tighter internal structure exists among the clans. No clan binds its neonates so strictly. And no clan acts with such unity of purpose as the Tremere. Although younger clan members generally are free to do more or less as they wish, occasionally they receive instructions from their elders that they may not ignore. Paranoia keeps the clan well-oiled and unified. 

Of course, the we do encourage individual achievement among the group, seeing it as a Darwinian method of ensuring our clan's strength. With such ambitious, powerful young vampires cooperating with such commendable clan unity, it's no wonder why we have plenty of envious and spiteful enemies among the Kindred.

By clan law, all neonate Tremere must drink the blood of the seven elders when we are created. All Tremere are at least one step toward being blood bound to their elders, and therefore usually act with great clan loyalty - in order to avoid having such loyalty forced on them. What's more, this arrangement means that the Tremere are less likely to resist the will of the elders.

Many Tremere dabbled in occult, some were mages, or other had scholarly pursuits in life. However, a fascination with the unknown is hardly enough to draw a Sire's attention; we must seek "apprentices" with aggressive natures and clear thinking.
Would you like to learn about what they do or train in the next level?
Which would you like to learn more on?

Which Path are you seeking to learn on?

Auspex is a Discipline that grants vampires supernatural senses. It is one of the most common and favored Discipline among Cainites due to its versatility and overall usefulness in just about every facet of vampiric existence. Dominate is a Discipline that overwhelms another person's mind with the vampire's will, forcing victims to think or act according to the vampire's decree. Thaumaturgy is blood magic exclusive to us. There are different paths to choose from and each will yield different things.

We may maintain our own individual havens, the clan maintains a chantry in every city that harbors a strong Tremere presence. The chantry is of course open to any of the Tremere's bloodline and absolutely forbidden to all others. We are infamous for our well-guarded havens; almost all will boast mystical wards that even other Tremere would find difficult to circumvent.
I am in need of blood for my magics.
